intro: Echinosophora koreensis, commonly known as Korean echinosophora, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and is adapted to temperate climates. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, a common feature among leguminous plants. Echinosophora koreensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
